job.title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
job.description: Are you passionate about machine learning and looking for an opportunity to make an impact in healthcare?<br><br>Fathom is on a mission to understand and structure the world’s medical data, starting by making sense of the terabytes of clinician notes contained within the electronic health records of health systems.<br><br>We are seeking extraordinary Machine Learning Engineers to join our team, developers and scientists who can not only design machine-based systems, but also think creatively about the human interactions necessary to augment and train those systems.<br><br>Please note, this position has a minimum requirement of 3+ years of experience. For earlier career candidates, we encourage you to apply to our SF and/or Toronto locations.<br><br><strong><u>As a Machine Learning Engineer You Will<br></u></strong><ul><li>You will develop NLP systems that help us structure and understand biomedical information and patient records</li><li>You will work with a variety of structured and unstructured data sources</li><li>You will imagine and implement creative data-acquisition and labeling systems, using tools &amp; techniques like crowdsourcing and novel active learning approaches</li><li>You will work with the latest NLP approaches (BERT, Transformer)</li><li>You will train your models at scale (Horovod, Nvidia v100s)</li><li>You will use and iterate on scalable and novel machine learning pipelines (Airflow on Kubernetes)</li><li>You will read and integrate state of the art techniques into Fathom’s ML infrastructure such as Mixed Precision on Transformer networks<br></li></ul><strong><u>We’re Looking For Teammates Who Bring<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years of development experience in a company/production setting</li><li>Experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch</li><li>Industry or academic experience working on a range of ML problems, particularly NLP</li><li>Strong software development skills, with a focus on building sound and scalable ML</li><li>Excitement about taking ground-breaking technologies and techniques to one of the most important and most archaic industries</li><li>A real passion for finding, analyzing, and incorporating the latest research directly into a production environment.</li><li>Good intuition for understanding what good research looks like, and where we should focus effort to maximize outcomes.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Bonus Points If You Have Experience With<br></u></strong><ul><li>Developing and improving core NLP components—not just grabbing things off the shelf</li><li>Leading large-scale crowd-sourcing data labeling and acquisition (Amazon Turk, Crowdflower, etc.)<br></li></ul>
